Today’s topic is how the People's Republic of China (PRC) has long been waging economic war against us and the damage it has done to our trade balance, industrial base, commercial and state secrets and national security.
Fortunately, the fact that Communist China has actually been waging “unrestricted warfare” against the United States for decades is the focus of an important congressional hearing today.
Frank Gaffney, Jr. is president of the Center for Security Policy (CSP), a columnist for The Washington Times, and host of the nationally syndicated program, Secure Freedom Radio.
Amidst the political jockeying in Washington, D.C. to establish which party is more hostile to Vladimir Putin’s Russia, an even more ominous threat is getting scant attention.
For the second time in recent months, U.S. House Intelligence Committee Chairman Devin Nunes will conduct an unclassified review of China’s hostile actions.
The hearing is particularly timely in light of President Trump’s efforts to use tariffs, investment restrictions and other measures to fight back.
